body.p:
Your letter of yesterday’s
date came to hand this morning
with the handsome order for another
box of books (30 Pa & 15 do.) By this time
the Box is at the Depot and will soon
been on its way to PittsburgPittsburgh.

I am glad to know that your
efforts are bringing you continued success
and am quite sanguine that this
summer’s labors are going to yield you
well nigh fifteen hundred dollars. Clear
gain, at least I have been so predicting
about the matter.

I am happy to say that I
have a few other young men who
are doing very nicely. One in New bern
N.C. and another in Delaware, and
another in
N.J. and still another in Buffalo N.Y. I have in all at least
thirty (30) agents in the field and they are
still coming along daily.

With regard to Jones at Monongahela
City, if he gives good references
I think I would like to appoint him.
I wrote him and layedlaid down the law to him
2 pretty plainly, so that he might understand
me, hence if his answer
comes back all right I think I shall
give him an agency.

I have put in your box 3 books
marked "Editor’s Copy”. Now if you
will try and deliver them in person I
doubt not but you will derive some
benefit therefrom at any rate you will
get good notices.

I put you in a number
of circulars. If I do not send enough
let me know it.

Willie is about the same.
He does some old fashion coughs
and no mistake.

Coal is dull, as I expected
it would be just now.
however we put in an order of 12
tons for Miss Morris on Spruce St
and I want to put
as soon as possible next
week so that I may do it when
horses are on hand. I failed to get
as yet. And as to selling
that cannot be accomplished
3 therefore get out as many orders as I
can and then let one of the horses go to
the country for 2 weeks and afterwards
bring him home and let the other go.

Never was I more sanguine
than now that I shall succeed in
selling fifty thousand copies of my books.
Hence Reading R.R. does not
trouble me. It is however giving trouble
to some others.

postscript.p:
You must have waked up matters
in PittsburgPittsburgh.
